content.raw:
Allowing `Model::GetJoint` to accept un-scoped joint names was deprecated in pull request #1067 with a console warning message (it's a run-time thing behavior not a build-time thing). It gives the following message:
~~~
[Wrn] [Model.cc:569] Calling Model::GetJoint(lower_joint) with un-scoped joint name is deprecated, please scope
~~~
Searching through our Jenkins logs shows many instances of this in our test suite. [For example](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/733/consoleFull), the following tests have this error:
~~~
103: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.ForceTorqueTest/0
143: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/JointLiftDragPluginTest.LiftDragPlugin1/0
157: [ RUN      ] GripperTest.Close
...
~~~
content.html:
Allowing Model::GetJoint to accept un-scoped joint names was deprecated in pull request #1067 with a console warning message (it's a run-time thing behavior not a build-time thing). It gives the following message:

[Wrn] [Model.cc:569] Calling Model::GetJoint(lower_joint) with un-scoped joint name is deprecated, please scope

Searching through our Jenkins logs shows many instances of this in our test suite. For example, the following tests have this error:

103: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.ForceTorqueTest/0
143: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/JointLiftDragPluginTest.LiftDragPlugin1/0
157: [ RUN      ] GripperTest.Close
...
